description.narrative: Output 2.3: Children, parents and community members are engaged in outreach, school life and social cohesion, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Early Learning, Education In Emergencies, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 2. EDUCATIONQUALITY EDUCATION SYSTEM RESPONDS TO INCREASED DEMAND, MEETING THE NEEDS OF VULNERABLE CHILDREN

participating-org.narrative: AMERICA MIDEAST EDUCATION AND TRAINING COMPANY INC

sector.narrative: Provision of (formal and non-formal) early-learning / pre-primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) teacher training
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness

title.narrative: Description of UNICEF programming approach framework at the country level with Common Country Assessments (CCAs) providing the equivalence of pre project appraisals
Interagency Humanitarian Response Assessments and Plans
UN Sustainable Development Group Database of Common Country Analyses
UNINFO Document Database to search for Common Country Analysis and Cooperation Framework
UNICEF Policy on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF Procedure on Harmonized Approach to Cash Transfers to Implementing Partners
UNICEF procedure for programme implementation partnerships
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Jordan 2021 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.3: Children, parents and community members are engaged in outreach, school life and social cohesion

description.narrative: UNICEF conducted more two rounds of Learning for All campaign reaching out than 134,000 children in total. The campaign led to new interventions (transportation and cash assistance) to overcome demand-related barriers to education. Both were rolled out to reach children by end of the year. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2018

title.narrative: Number of boys and girls, parents, community members provided with information relevant for education and assisted with referral services
Number of learners receiving reading interventions at the primary level
Percent of children benefiting from reading interventions who demonstrate improved reading practices

actual.value: 2016:This assessment will be conducted between December 2016 and June 2017. Results will be available in mid-2017.
